div.p: Just generally about their self-esteem, things like that, that’s the best bit of it to be honest. And obviously if they come out, if they’ve been excluded
from school and they’ve passed qualifications and they’ve moved on to college obviously that’s a huge, huge achievement for them
and something that I’m proud of being involved with... Because obviously I’m working in youth inclusion setting they have to come to us
because they’ve either been expelled from school or are at risk of exclusion so it’s a different reason why they’re coming, and dancing is
they want to come, they want to learn, they want to engage...
I firstly met a youth worker when I was teaching dancing and so yeah I got to spend time with them and I enjoyed watching them interact
with the young people and I just thought it was something that I would like to get into, youth work.
